explainers.title: More information about VAT and excise
explainers.xprose:
• VAT is a national tax charged in addition to any other duties that apply.
  • {{ vat_text }}
  • Excise is an additional tax levied on certain goods and commodities produced or sold within a country and on licences granted for certain activities.
explainers.prose_ni:
• VAT is a national tax charged in addition to any other duties that apply. {{ vat_text }}
  • Excise is an additional tax levied on certain goods and commodities produced or sold within a country and on licences granted for certain activities.

items.description: VAT is a national tax charged in addition to any other duties that apply. Please see guidance for when zero rate VAT applies.

explainers.title: What are the main types of tariffs and charges
explainers.prose:
• A third country duty is the duty payable in the absence of any other type of tariff measure.
  • A supplementary unit is used when an additional measurement unit is needed, for example, the quantity as well as the weight of the products.
  • A tariff preference means that you pay a lower or nil rate of import duty on your goods. To qualify, goods must meet the rules of origin.
explainers.prosex:
• A third country duty is the duty payable in the absence of any other type of tariff measure.
  • A supplementary unit is used when an additional measurement unit is needed, for example, the quantity as well as the weight of the products.
  • A tariff preference means that you pay a lower or nil rate of import duty on your goods. To qualify, goods must meet the rules of origin.
explainers.prose_ni:
• A third country duty is the duty payable in the absence of any other type of tariff measure.
  • A supplementary unit is used when an additional measurement unit is needed, for example, the quantity as well as the weight of the products.
  • A tariff preference means that you pay a lower or nil rate of import duty on your goods. To qualify, goods must meet the rules of origin.

explainers.title: More information about quotas
explainers.prose:
Quotas allow a limited amount of goods to be imported at a lower duty rate. Once the quota has been used up, you will revert to your out-of-quota rate – which may be the third country duty or a preferential rate.

Quotas can be non-preferential (open to many countries) or preferential (restricted to a particular trading partner).
explainers.prose_ni:
Quotas allow a limited amount of goods to be imported at a lower duty rate. Once the quota has been used up, you will revert to your out-of-quota rate – which may be the third country duty or a preferential rate.

Quotas can be non-preferential (open to many countries) or preferential (restricted to a particular trading partner).

remedies.block: Trade Remedies, safeguards and retaliatory duties
remedies.block_xi: Trade Remedies, safeguards and retaliatory duties

explainers.title: More information about Trade Remedies and safeguards
explainers.prose: World Trade Organization rules prevent artificially cheap imports from damaging markets. This guide explains how anti-dumping duties and 'countervailing' (or anti-subsidy) measures work.
explainers.prose_ni: World Trade Organization rules prevent artificially cheap imports from damaging markets. This guide explains how anti-dumping duties and 'countervailing' (or anti-subsidy) measures work.

explainers.title: More information about import controls
explainers.prose:
Import controls can be either prohibitions, where goods cannot be imported under any circumstances, or restrictions, where goods can be imported only under certain circumstances. Find out more about UK import prohibitions and restrictions.

Get detailed guidance on importing commodity {{ commodity }} from {{ country_name }} (Link opens in a new browser window).
explainers.prose_ni: Check how to move goods into and out of Northern Ireland.

explainers.title: More information about import controls
explainers.prose: Explicitly UK - Import controls can be either prohibitions, where goods cannot be imported under any circumstances, or restrictions, where goods can be imported only under certain circumstances. Find out more about UK import prohibitions and restrictions.
explainers.prose_ni: If you are bringing goods into Northern Ireland from outside of the UK and the European Union, you will need to ensure that you adhere to UK import controls.
